bibl.title: Letter from B.H. Ransom to Henry Rose Carter, May 15, 1925

div1.p: Ransom reports that Carter has been named honorary president of the American Society of Tropical Medicine.

div1.head: Letter from B.H. Ransom to Henry Rose Carter, May 15, 1925
div1.opener:

TROPICAL MEDICINE
ADDRESS REPLY TO
P. O. BOX 131, PENNSYLVANIA AVENUE STATION
WASHINGTON, D. C.
May 15, 1925.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
2122 California Street,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
It gives me pleasure to inform you that as a mark of
appreciation and esteem for your accomplishments in the field of
Tropical Medicine and the great interest that you have always
taken in this Society you were elected to the office of Honorary
President. The active duties of the Office of President have
been placed upon Dr. J. F. Siler, Medical Corps, U. S. A.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, B H Ransom
Secretary. BHR/HM
